intro: Cyrtandra × nuda, commonly known as the naked cyrtandra, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Pacific, including Hawaii and parts of Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its simple, often hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or rocky crevices. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
